intro: Polygala nuttallii, commonly known as Nuttall's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, showy flowers that typically bloom in late spring or early summer. The plant produces small, cylindrical fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Polygala nuttallii is an important component of its native ecosystem, supporting various pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
